The sight of troops in Boston’s toniest neighborhood in recent days has been jarringOn Boylston Street on Thursday, a handful of soldiers stood in their fatigues. A block away, in front of an upscale women’s boutique, a soldier sat on the hood of a massive military vehicle. And on Newbury Street another cluster of armed troops kept watch near Tiffany’s and the boarded-up Burberry store.

The sight of troops in Boston’s toniest neighborhood in recent days has been jarringOn Boylston Street on Thursday, a handful of soldiers stood in their fatigues. A block away, in front of an upscale women’s boutique, a soldier sat on the hood of a massive military vehicle. And on Newbury Street another cluster of armed troops kept watch near Tiffany’s and the boarded-up Burberry store.
